value.title: Can we have ANIMATED Power BI visuals?
value.excerpt: Can we have animated Power BI visuals? Patrick gives it a try to see what you can do to animate your bar charts and pie charts. value.title: Debug DAX using Variables in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Marco Russo, from SQL BI, joins Patrick to look at how you can debug DAX using variables in Power BI. Marco helps to break down a DAX measure and show how you can see the results as you build it up to find where the problem is.  SQL BI https://sqlbi.com  DAX Formatter https://www.daxformatter.com/

value.title: Easily convert your Excel Power Pivot model to Power BI
value.excerpt: Take your Power Pivot model in Excel and easily convert it to Power BI in just a few steps. Patrick looks at a few different ways to do this.  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? value.title: Enable QUERY FOLDING for native queries in Power Query / Power BI
value.excerpt: We have usually said that if you use a native query, you break query folding in Power Query. Interesting. There may be a way to enable it in Power BI! Patrick shows you how.  Chris Webb Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2021/02/21/query-folding-on-sql-queries-in-power-query-using-value-nativequery-and-enablefoldingtrue/

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

value.title: Review Performance Analyzer in this Power BI Report from Smart Power BI

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: How to Set Up Power BI Gateway to Connect to On Premise Data in Personal Mode
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources ‚Äì like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. value.title: Blank row in DAX
value.excerpt: VALUES and DISTINCT are two functions that differ in how they could add a blank row to the result (or not). value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870
